titles: By the Kyng and the Quene where as many good and profitable lawes, statutes, and ordynaunces haue bene heretofore made and deuysed, for the good gouernement, order and common weale of this realme ...
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1553-1558 : Mary I)
Mary I, Queen of England, 1516-1558.
publisher: In ædibus Iohannis Cawodi typographi Regiæ Maiestatis,
notes: Other title information from first four lines of text.
"Geuen under our Signes Manuell, at our honoure of Hampton courte the xxvi. day of May, the fyrst and second yeares of our reygnes."
Reproduction of original in: Society of Antiquaries.
keywords: Church and state --  England --  Early works to 1800.
